primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Introductory course to Portuguese for students with no previous knowledge of this language or advanced proficiency in Spanish. Students develop basic knowledge and reading, listening, speaking and writing skills, within a communicative approach. Students are introduced to cultural aspects of the Portuguese-speaking world. Taught in English and Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese for Beginners I
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT100Y1, PRT102H1, PRT120Y1, PRT120H1, PRT201H1, PRT202H1, PRT205H1, PRT219Y1, PRT220Y1, PRT301H1, PRT302H1, PRT320Y1, PRT420H1, PRT420Y1

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: A continuation of introductory Portuguese for non-native speakers. Students will expand their basic knowledge of cultural aspects of the Portuguese-speaking world and their reading, listening, speaking and writing skills in the target language. Taught in English and Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese for Beginners II
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT100Y1, PRT120Y1, PRT120H1, PRT201H1, PRT202H1, PRT205H1, PRT219Y1, PRT220Y1, PRT301H1, PRT302H1, PRT320Y1, PRT420H1, PRT420Y1

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to the Portuguese language for speakers of Spanish. Development of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills with an emphasis on communication, and an overview of basic grammatical structures and building of vocabulary. Presentation of cultural aspects of the Portuguese-speaking world.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese for Spanish Speakers
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Native or advanced knowledge of Spanish, SPA320Y1/ SPA302H1 for non-native speakers of Spanish; no previous knowledge of Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT100Y1, PRT120Y1, PRT201H1, PRT202H1, PRT205H1, PRT219Y1, PRT219H1, PRT220Y1, PRT301H1, PRT302H1, PRT320Y1, PRT420Y1, PRT420H1

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: This course expands the linguistic repertoire of learners beyond basic structures by offering a review of grammar at an intermediate level. Introduction to authentic cultural materials from the Portuguese-speaking world with practice designed to build vocabulary, and to improve oral and written expression. Taught in Portuguese with occasional English.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate Portuguese I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PRT100Y1/ PRT102H1/ PRT120Y1/ PRT120H1 or placement test
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT202H1, PRT205H1, PRT219Y1, PRT219H1, PRT220Y1, PRT301H1, PRT302H1, PRT320Y1, PRT420Y1, PRT420H1

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: This course continues to expand the linguistic repertoire of learners to a high intermediate level, expanding the use of authentic cultural materials from the Portuguese-speaking world and promoting increased development of vocabulary, and oral and written expression. Taught in Portuguese with occasional English.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate Portuguese II
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT205H1, PRT219Y1, PRT219H1, PRT220Y1, PRT301H1, PRT302H1, PRT320Y1, PRT420Y1, PRT420H1

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: For students who have had exposure to spoken Portuguese in an informal context (living in a Portuguese speaking country, or in a Portuguese speaking family) but little to no exposure to written Portuguese. Besides reviewing English/Portuguese spelling differences, written and spoken registers of Portuguese, and basic aspects of the grammatical system, the course (1) provides students with the essential understanding of Portuguese grammatical system; (2) builds their vocabulary; and (3) trains them to express themselves formally in both spoken and written Portuguese. Taught in English and Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese for Heritage Speakers
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Basic to relatively high ability to speak and understand Portuguese, limited or no formal education in Portuguese, or placement test.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT100Y1, PRT101H1, PRT102H1, PRT120Y1, PRT120H1, PRT201H1, PRT202H1, PRT219Y1, PRT219H1, PRT220Y1, PRT301H1, PRT302H1, PRT320Y1, PRT420H1, PRT420Y1

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Overview of Portuguese speech sounds (articulation and transcription). The course provides perception and pronunciation training of Portuguese vowels, consonants, stress, intonation, and co-articulation phenomena in connected speech. The main focus will be on European Portuguese and Brazilian Portuguese, but differences between these two and other Portuguese accents will be discussed as well.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese Pronunciation
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT219Y1, PRT219H1, PRT205H1, native speakers of Portuguese

courses.name: Introduction to the Cultures of the Portuguese-Speaking World

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: A survey of historical and cultural trends in the Portuguese-speaking world, from colonial past to the present. (Offered in alternate years; taught in English)
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to the Cultures of the Portuguese-Speaking World

courses.name: Introduction to the Literatures of the Portuguese-Speaking World

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Students expand their reading, writing, and critical skills through the study of a representative selection of short stories and poetry from Portugal, Brazil, and Lusophone Africa. Required for a program degree. Taught in Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to the Literatures of the Portuguese-Speaking World

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Intensive practice in written and oral Portuguese for the student with advanced proficiency in the language. Selective review of grammar with emphasis on complex language structures. Taught in Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Portuguese I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PRT202H1/ PRT205H1/ PRT219Y1/ PRT219H1/ PRT220Y1 or placement test

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: This course continues to improve written and oral proficiency for the student with advanced proficiency in Portuguese, offering a selective review of grammar with emphasis on the complex sentence. Taught in Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Portuguese II

cmCourseInfo.description: An advanced level business Portuguese course covering topics on international relations, politics, legal and culture. This course aims to enhance written and oral expressions in Portuguese through content focusing on the language that is used in official, diplomatic, and financial situations. Through the analysis of case studies, newspapers and videos, students will be introduced to the business cultures and intercultural communication of the Portuguese-speaking world. Taught in Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Business Portuguese
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PRT120Y1/ PRT120H1/ PRT202H1/ PRT205H1/ PRT220Y1 or Portuguese placement test

cmCourseInfo.description: An overview of the varieties of Portuguese spoken in four continents (Europe, South America, Africa, Asia) and a discussion of the structural similarities and differences between the two most extensively studied varieties: European and Brazilian Portuguese. Analysis of linguistic variation in contemporary Portuguese in terms of phonetics, syntax and lexicon. (Offered in alternate years.)
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese Language in the World
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PRT202H1/ PRT205H1/ PRT219Y1/ PRT219H1/ PRT120Y1/ PRT220Y1 or Portuguese placement test.

cmCourseInfo.description: A study of advanced aspects of formal Portuguese through reading and extensive writing practice, with an aim at developing skills necessary for academic and professional writing and oral presentations.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Academic Portuguese

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Individual study with a member of staff on a topic of common interest including readings, discussion and written assignments. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Study
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PRT320Y1 and written approval of the Undergraduate Coordinator

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

For details on enrolling in this course, please visit the Portuguese program website: https://www.spanport.utoronto.ca/undergraduate/programs/portuguese/independent-studies
